intro: Jacobaea mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Jacobaea mucronata is often found in disturbed soils and can be a persistent weed in agricultural settings.
